Test Name: Lupus Anticoagulant Evaluation with Reflex Testing
Specimen Type: Platelet-poor plasma (PPP) derived from citrated blood
Purpose: To detect and confirm the presence of lupus anticoagulant antibodies, guiding diagnosis and management of thrombotic risk.
Equipment: Centrifuge (2500 x g) and coagulation analyzer capable of LA-sensitive aPTT, mixing studies, and confirmatory testing
